content: Meeting time. Creating a Jitsi room in lieu of Zoom...
time to see how well joining jitsi from my phone works
I won't be able to attend live, unfortunately (something came up with work that needs my main attention, though not my full attention, per se...)
I can participate via Zulip (partial attention), to e.g. provide my own availability and scheduling info
https://meet.jit.si/hFbBsF4ay1CqkAET
/me grabs the meeting template.
https://hackmd.io/b-RgzUkuQUK-fN26li35eg?edit
cc @T-lang

@pnkfelix What is your availability for:

  • 2021-04-13: meeting title
  • 2021-04-20: meeting title
  • 2021-04-27: meeting title
looking

And, do either of the topics in https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Ameeting-proposal+-label%3Ameeting-scheduled seem ready for a presentation this month? We have other topics, no pressure.
I'm not available on 2022-04-27.
One of them seems like it needs @Jack Wrenn's availability.
I'm available for the other two dates, 2022-04-13 and 2022-04-20
@Jack Wrenn is busy with their thesis defense this week so I don't know their availability. I think I'd wait until the next cycle to schedule that work that involves Jack.
Non-terminal divergence seems like it isn't time-sensitive.
did we want to try a follow-up mtg re lints?
or should we continue with further async discussion first
cc @nikomatsakis Would you have bandwidth for implied bounds and perfect derive by the 13th?

One potential schedule:

  • 2021-04-13: Implied bounds, perfect derive: https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/152
  • 2021-04-20: Research overview: https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/155
  • 2021-04-27: Backlog Bonanza
    * pnkfelix not available
I'm okay with that schedule
If Niko can't do implied bounds and perfect derive on the 13th, we could swap it out for either a lint policy discussion or more Backlog Bonanza.
Putting together a blog post right now.
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/956
@simulacrum Would you mind providing a review on that?
(You should be able to merge -- partially using as a test of permissions :)
I do have merge permissions, once the review requirements are met.
